# puredns (bruteforce)

Install
go install -v github.com/d3mondev/puredns/v2/cmd/puredns@latest

Run (Linux; from repo root)
# Requires:
# - temp/agent1/subdomain_wordlist.txt
# - temp/agent1/resolvers_good.txt (recommended; generated by resolver prune test)
#   OR temp/agent1/resolvers_2000.txt
#   OR task/task5/resolvers_curated.txt (small but stable)

Resolver setup (PowerShell; from repo root)
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force temp/agent1 | Out-Null

# Option 1 (recommended): create a pruned resolver list
# See: task/task5/resolver-prune-test.txt

# Option 2: use a curated small list
Copy-Item task/task5/resolvers_curated.txt temp/agent1/resolvers_good.txt -Force

mkdir -p temp/agent1
puredns bruteforce temp/agent1/subdomain_wordlist.txt <domain> \
  --resolvers temp/agent1/resolvers_good.txt \
  --write temp/agent1/list_3_bruteforce.txt

Batch mode (if wordlist is huge / to stay under 9 minutes)
split -l 100000 temp/agent1/subdomain_wordlist.txt temp/agent1/wl_
: > temp/agent1/list_3_bruteforce.txt
for f in temp/agent1/wl_*; do
  puredns bruteforce "$f" <domain> --resolvers temp/agent1/resolvers_good.txt --write temp/agent1/_brute_tmp.txt
  cat temp/agent1/_brute_tmp.txt >> temp/agent1/list_3_bruteforce.txt
done
sort -u temp/agent1/list_3_bruteforce.txt -o temp/agent1/list_3_bruteforce.txt

Windows note
# Recommended: run the above via WSL (Ubuntu) so you can use split/sort.
# If staying in PowerShell, run without batching first (smaller wordlist), or tell me your wordlist size and Iâ€™ll add a PowerShell batching snippet.
